Don Ward: Fix - Make map() thread safe
  Two global variables maps2 and maps3 were used in map(). 
  Move them to thread-local storage so different threads 
  do not trash each other's copies.

   M /trunk/unicon/src/runtime/rmemmgt.r
   M /trunk/unicon/src/runtime/rsys.r

collapse struct context into coexpression block

The context struct has been expanded with many fields and is not maintained
in the cstate anymore. Most fields belong in either the coexpression block
or the thread state. All fields are migrated to the the coexpression block
for now. Some of them will be moved to the thread state later. This simplifies
maintaining the state of a coexpression/thread.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4486 | to_jafar | 2016-08-25 03:50:52 +0530 (Thu, 25 Aug 2016) | 9 lines

   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/tp.c
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/tpmhttp.c
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/uri/uri.c
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/uri/uri.h
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/uri/uri_http.c
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/uri/uri_schm.h
   M /trunk/unicon/src/runtime/rmsg.r

Don't add the port to the HOST field in the HTTP header unless explicitly set by the the user

Some HTTP servers are picky (buggy?) and don't like to see the optional
port appended to the HOST field inside the HTTP header. For this reason,
keep the port out by default. This allows a client to respond to a 301
error by following the returned location field to the 'letter'.
More fine tuning might be required to cover various cases.


------------------------------------------------------------------------
r4485 | to_jafar | 2016-08-24 00:01:01 +0530 (Wed, 24 Aug 2016) | 3 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/unicon/src/libtp/tpdssl.c

A new (proper) fix for the monitoring bug superceding r4482 

   With native coswitch  one or more coexp share the same thread state
   causing their lastop to be overwritten. 
   Move lastop from thread state to be part of the coexp struct such that
   each coexp has its own copy of lastop.

Drop unnecessary declarations of curtstate_ce

CURTSTATE() macro doesn't declare curtstate_ce anymore. A new macro CURTSTATE_AND_CE() is introduced to do the job. This removes about 150 occurences where curtstate_ce was declared/initialized but not used. This can be further optimized in many places by accessing curtstate->c directly and avoiding the need for curtstate_ce when only a single access is needed.

fix unicon a b/c.u

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1253 | emunson | 2006-01-30 11:09:40 +0530 (Mon, 30 Jan 2006) | 11 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/unicon/uni/udb/Makefile
   A /trunk/unicon/uni/udb/auto.y
   M /trunk/unicon/uni/udb/filenames.icn
   M /trunk/unicon/uni/udb/udb.icn


filenames.icn is the merge of changes made to clean up a few of the
intial assumptions made and the addition of code to handle compressed
ICode.

The file auto.y and the changes made to udb.icn are the addition of
several tools to aid in debugging unicon programs.  These tools are not
well documented yet, but the documentation is coming.  Unless they are
explicitly enabled by the user they will not affect the exectution of

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r172 | phliar | 2001-12-12 12:30:39 +0530 (Wed, 12 Dec 2001) | 9 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/unicon/src/runtime/rposix.r

Lots O' Bug Fixes!  Fixed all regressions on OpenBSD. (Will confirm
everything works on Linux and FreeBSD, and possibly Solaris 8, soon.)
Primarily: lots of code cleanup, especially the socket code; it's
almost a major re-write of PF_INET. PF_UNIX sockets work; PF_INET with
INADDR_ANY almost works; all structs have been brought up to spec
i.e. all the length fields etc. correctly filled in; put back a field
in the posix_stat record that got lost somewhere. Still left to do:
select() will seg fault; PF_INET/INADDR_ANY still needs some work.
